sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"相信，信任"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: belief, faith, confidence, conviction, credit, trust
means: belief ： 普通用词，指单纯从主观上的相信，不着重这种相信是否有根据。
faith ： 语气较强，强调完全相信；有时也能仅凭感觉产生的相信。
confidence ： 指对某人某事有充分信心，断定不会使人失望，因而给予信任。
conviction ： 多指根据长期交往或实践，对某人某事有了认识和了解后产生的信心和相信，侧重其坚定性。
credit ： 语气最弱，着重以声誉为信任的基础。
trust ： 强调相信、信任的完全可靠。

word_mean: 根据来自母体的一组子样（即观测值），对表征母体的参数进行估计的统计可信程度。

sentence.Network_en: He has never exhibited the self-confidence, bordering on arrogance, of his predecessor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从未表现出他前任的那种近乎傲慢的自信。

sentence.Network_en: Hopes of an early cut in interest rates bolstered confidence.
sentence.Network_cn: 利率有望早日下调，从而增强了人们的信心。

sentence.Network_en: He walked towards the summerhouse, at first furtively, then with more confidence.
sentence.Network_cn: 他朝凉亭走去，开始还偷偷摸摸地，后来就壮大了胆子。

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... confidant n 知心朋友 confidence n 自信，信任 confident a 自信的.
置信度(confidence)、支持度(support)、提升度(lift)是关联发现的三个重要评价指标。下面以SAS自带的数据SAMPSIO.ASSOCS为例 …
...越多的有限责任公司的股东等的利益，促进经济的发展。在林伯格看来，审计这一专门化的行业，要求有较强的“信任”(confidence)度，而信任的技术要求包括独立性和专业技能等。鉴于此，林伯格认为，内部审计是不值得信赖的。3评价林伯格.

jx.jx_en_mean: in a position of trust with someone

jx.jx_cn_mean: 向某人透露秘密，把某人当作知己

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin confidentia, from confidere 'have full trust' (see confident)

entry.def: If you have confidence in someone, you feel that you can trust them.

example.ex: I have every confidence in you...
This has contributed to the lack of confidence in the police...
example.tran: 这导致了大家对警方缺乏信任。

entry.def: If you have confidence, you feel sure about your abilities, qualities, or ideas.

example.ex: The band is on excellent form and brimming with confidence...
example.tran: 这支乐队状态极佳，自信满满。

example.ex: I always thought the worst of myself and had no confidence whatsoever.
example.tran: 我老是妄自菲薄，没有一点儿信心。

entry.def: If you can say something with confidence, you feel certain it is correct.

example.ex: I can say with confidence that such rumors were totally groundless.
example.tran: 我可以肯定地说这样的谣言完全没有根据。

entry.def: If you tell someone something in confidence, you tell them a secret.

example.ex: We told you all these things in confidence...
example.tran: 我们告诉你的这些事都需要保密。

example.ex: Even telling Lois seemed a betrayal of confidence.
example.tran: 即使是告诉洛伊丝都好像是在泄密。

entry.def: A confidence is a secret that you tell someone.

example.tran: 格雷戈里和卡门说了知心话。

means.word_mean: 1. freedom from doubt; belief in yourself and your abilities;

sentences.sentence: "his assurance in his superiority did not make him popular"
"after that failure he lost his confidence"

means.word_mean: 2. a feeling of trust (in someone or something);
3. a state of confident hopefulness that events will be favorable;
5. a secret that is confided or entrusted to another;

sentences.sentence: "the priest could not reveal her confidences"

auth_sentence.content: The first is now settled to very high confidence.

stems_affixes.word_buile: confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ent……的→adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 秘[机]密的;表示信任的;担任机密工作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: confident[adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的]+ial……的→相信的人才知道
dif不+fid相信+ent……的→不相信[自己]→自卑的
fid信任,相信,信念+uciary……的→相信的→信托的
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
af一再+fid信任,相信,信念+avit表名词→一再发誓相信→宣誓书
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ant人→confidant可以吐露真情的人
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ence表名词→n.[in]信任;信心,自信;秘密,机密
fid信任,相信,信念+elity表示性质→相信的性质
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
per假+fid相信+y状态→假相信→不忠诚

Sentence.sentence: It increases people's confidence in the economy.
Cheating undermines confidence and independence: the cheater is a fraud, and knows that without dishonesty, he/she would have failed.
But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.
A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression.
Comparing 1929 with 2007-09, Christina Romer, the head of President Obama's Council of Economic Advisers, finds the initial blow to confidence far greater now than then

jushi.english: They sat in a corner exchanging confidences.
jushi.chinese: 他们坐在角落里说着悄悄话。

jushi.english: The servant enjoyed his master's confidence.
jushi.chinese: 这佣人深得主人的信任。

jushi.english: I had confidence, however, in my own youth and energy.
jushi.chinese: 然而，我对自己的青春和精力充满了信心。
